ForgottenPasswordTemplate.enterLogin: Please enter your username, we will send you an email containing instructions on how to reset your password.
ForgottenPasswordTemplate.emailSubject: OpenAM: You have requested a password reset
ForgottenPasswordTemplate.emailMessage:
Hello from OpenAM, 

You have requested to have your ForgeRock account's password reset.

If you want to reset your password then follow the link below.

**Note: If you encounter an error message when you click on this link, please copy the url and paste it into your browser instead.
ForgottenPasswordTemplate.emailSent: We have sent you an e-mail, please follow the link in the e-mail to complete your password reset process.

modules.title: Authentication Modules
modules.description: OpenAM uses authentication modules to identify the user. Normally authentication modules are associated with an authentication chain. Each realm has a default authentication chain that will be used to authenticate users. This section is used to add, configure or remove authentication module available for authentication into this realm.

chains.title: Authentication Chains
chains.description: Use authentication chains to define the steps a subject takes to authenticate. Authentication chains consist of a series of one or more authentication modules, with credentials being passed down the chain to each module instance.
chains.duplicateChain: A Chain with the same name already exists

editChains.redirectUrlsHelp: Specify the URL to which the subject is redirected. You can specify separate URLs for authenticating successfully and when authentication fails.
editChains.moduleHelp: Add modules to the authentication chain, and select the continuation and failure semantics with one of the following four flags: required, optional, requisite, or sufficient.

processingClass.title: Post Authentication Processing Class

addClassNameDialog.title: Add new Class Name
addClassNameDialog.message: The new class name <mark>__newClassName__</mark> for Post Authentication Processing has not been saved. Do you want to save it?

processingClass.duplicateClass: A Class with the same name already exists
processingClass.help: Specify the name of a Java class to execute at the end of the authentication process.

realms.title: Realms
realms.description: Use realms to organize subjects and configuration data. Within each realm you can configure data stores, administration privileges, authentication chains, authorization policies, and other realm-specific settings.

warningDialog.title: Delete "__realmName__"?
warningDialog.activeMessage:
This is an active realm. All configuration data will be lost if deleted. You can set the realm as inactive to prevent login but retain configuration data.
Do you want to delete the realm?
warningDialog.inactiveMessage:
This is an inactive realm. No one can currently login. All configuration data will be lost if deleted.
Are you sure you want to delete the realm?

realmStatusPopover.title: Realm Status
realmStatusPopover.content: If the realm is disabled, all OpenAM services will be unavailable for all users in this realm.

realmAliasesPopover.title: Realm/DNS Aliases
realmAliasesPopover.content:
When a request is received by the authentication user interface, OpenAM searches this attribute in all realms to find the matching realm into which the user should be authenticated.
OpenAM must only find one matching realm so therefore do not put duplicate entries into multiple realms.
Additionally if OpenAM does not find a matching realm, the user is presented with an error screen.

SimpleTime.title: Time (day, date, time, and timezone)
SimpleTime.helperContent: Must contain one or more of the following values: Time (Start and End), Day (Start and End), Date (Start and End) and/or Time Zone.

conditionTypes.ipHelperContent: Enter at least one of Start IP, End IP or DNS Name. To match a single IP, enter it in either Start IP or End IP. Start IP must be less than or equal to End IP. DNS Name is an explicit match, or you can use a wildcard in the lowest sub-domain.
conditionTypes.legacyFormat: This condition is in a legacy format, and should be replaced.
